intro: Mentzelia laevicaulis var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has slender, branched stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. This variety is distinguished by its smaller flowers compared to other Mentzelia species.
